intro: Meryta capitata, commonly known as the New Zealand tree fern, is a species native to the subtropical regions of New Zealand. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and a crown of large, feather-like fronds. The plant has a slow growth rate and can reach heights of up to 10 meters in favorable conditions. Its fronds are typically bright green and can grow to lengths of over two meters. Meryta capitata is often found in coastal and lowland forests, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments.
